page_content:
**Relevant Ghanaian policies on nationally determined contributions, long-term strategies, national adaptation plans, strategies as reported in adaptation communications and national communications.**

- [Ghana’s Updated Nationally Determined Contribution to the UNFCCC_2021](https://mesti.gov.gh/documents/ghanas-updated-nationally-determined-contribution-unfccc_2021/) - identifies emission reduction and adaptation actions to be undertaken between 2020 and 2030 in the energy, transportation, agriculture, forestry and land use, waste, and industry sectors.

- [National Climate Change Policy (NCCP)](https://www.climate-laws.org/geographies/ghana/policies/national-climate-change-policy-nccp) - seeks to enhance climate resilience and adaptation across all sectors.

- [Ghana's Adaptation Communication to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change Nov. 2021](https://unfccc.int/sites/default/files/resource/Ghana_AdCom%20to%20the%20UNFCCC_November%202021_Final%20with%20foreword.pdf) - takes stock of what has been done and what has been achieved; it also looks at existing gaps and what else needs to be accomplished to consolidate Ghana’s adaptation gains going forward.
